For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# Acushnet Holdings Corp. (GOLF) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Current Stock Metrics (as of November 1, 2024, close; sourced from Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq):**
- Stock Price: $62.68
- Market Capitalization: $4.02 billion
- 52-Week Range: $48.00 - $69.62
- Trailing P/E: 20.4x
- Forward P/E: 17.8x

## Company Overview (187 words)
Acushnet Holdings Corp. (NYSE: GOLF) is a global leader in premium golf equipment and apparel, primarily through its iconic Titleist and FootJoy brands. Headquartered in Fairhaven, Massachusetts, the company designs, manufactures, and markets performance-oriented golf products sold in over 100 countries. Titleist dominates the golf ball category with the Pro V1 line, holds strong positions in golf clubs (drivers, irons, wedges via Vokey Design), shafts (ACCRA), and putters (Scotty Cameron). FootJoy leads in golf footwear, gloves, and apparel, emphasizing comfort and performance for all skill levels. Acushnet operates a hybrid go-to-market model: ~80% wholesale to retailers like PGA Tour Superstore, Dick's Sporting Goods (Golf Galaxy), and international pro shops; ~20% direct-to-consumer via Titleist.com and FootJoy.com, which grew rapidly post-COVID. The company benefits from high brand loyalty among professionals (e.g., Scottie Scheffler, Wyndham Clark) and amateurs, driven by R&D investment (~3-4% of revenue). With ~9,000 employees, Acushnet focuses on innovation amid golf's ~66 million global participants (National Golf Foundation data, 2024). Fiscal 2023 revenue was $2.45B, with golf balls contributing ~55%.

## Recent Developments
- **October 30, 2024**: Q3 2024 earnings release. Revenue $634.0M (-2.9% YoY); Titleist golf balls $352.3M (+5.0%); Titleist golf clubs/gear $82.7M (-18.4% due to distributor inventory destocking); FootJoy $152.4M (-3.3%). GAAP net income $96.7M ($1.50/share); adjusted EBITDA $140.7M (22.2% margin). Full-year 2024 guidance narrowed: revenue +2-3% (prior +3-5%), adj. EBITDA $505-525M.
- **October 9, 2024**: Announced Q4 product launches including new Titleist Pro V1/V1x golf balls (2025 model, available Jan 2025) and Vokey SM10 wedges.
- **July 31, 2024**: Q2 2024 earnings. Revenue $761.9M (+4.1% YoY); net income $152.4M.
- **June 2024**: Expanded DTC presence with new FootJoy flagship store in Carlsbad, CA.
- **April 2024**: Titleist Pro V1x Left Dash ball launched for high-speed players; adopted by pros like Xander Schauffele (2024 PGA Championship winner).
- Ongoing discussions (Seeking Alpha, Reddit r/stocks, Oct 2024): Investor focus on club sales recovery in 2025 amid destocking; positive on ball loyalty (50%+ repeat buys).

## Growth Strategy
- **Innovation Pipeline**: 10-15% annual R&D spend relative to category; 2025 launches: Titleist GT drivers/irons (faster ball speeds), FootJoy Premiere Series shoes.
- **DTC Expansion**: Targeting 25% of sales by 2026 (from 20%); new e-commerce tools, personalization (e.g., custom shafts).
- **International Growth**: Asia-Pacific up 10%+ in Q3 2024; new distributor deals in China/India.
- **Premium Pricing**: Maintain 40-45% gross margins via brand moat; loyalty programs like Titleist Insider.
- **Sustainability**: Recycled materials in FootJoy gloves (launched 2024).

## Company and Sector Headwinds/Tailwinds

| Category | Tailwinds | Headwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | Strong golf ball pricing power (+mid-single digits Q3); DTC resilience (+12% Q3); pro endorsements (e.g., Schefflerâ€™s Masters win). | Club destocking (-18% Q3 sales); supply chain costs up 2-3%; FX headwinds (strong USD). |
| **Sector-Wide (Golf Equipment, ~$10B US market)** | Participation rounds +2.5% YTD 2024 (NGF); millennial/gen-Z entry (+15% female juniors); aging boomers. | Economic sensitivity (discretionary spend); wet spring weather (-5% US rounds Q2); competition from indoor sims/gaming. |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Titleist**: Golf balls (Pro V1 family, 60%+ of sales), clubs (TSR drivers, T100 irons), Vokey wedges, Scotty Cameron putters, ACCRA shafts.
- **FootJoy**: Shoes (DryJoys, 40% market share), gloves (StaSof), apparel (performance outerwear).
- Services: Custom fitting via tour vans; online ball fitting tool (1M+ users annually).

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **2025 Titleist GT Family**: Faster drivers (launch Jan 16, 2025); testing shows +2-3 mph ball speed.
- **FootJoy PRO|SL 2025 Shoes**: Carbon fiber knit, Q1 2025 release.
- **DTC Enhancements**: AI-driven club fitting app (pilot Q4 2024).
- **ProV1 Sustainability Line**: 50% recycled materials, testing phase (2025 rollout).

## Market Share Approximations (2024 Estimates, Darryl Research/Golf Datatech)
- Golf Balls: Titleist 27% overall US (50%+ premium segment).
- Golf Clubs: 15-18% US (strong in irons/wedges).
- Golf Footwear: FootJoy 42% US.
- Global: ~20% equipment share.

**Forecast**: Modest share gains to 28-30% balls, 18-20% clubs by 2026 via innovation/DTC; flat/decline risk if participation stalls.

## Comparison to Competitors

| Metric (TTM as of Q3 2024) | GOLF | Callaway (MODG) | TaylorMade (Private) | Ping (Private) |
|----------------------------|------|------------------|----------------------|---------------|
| **Rev ($B)** | 2.4 | 4.2 (incl. Topgolf) | ~2.5 | ~1.2 |
| **EBITDA Margin** | 22% | 15% | 18% | 20% |
| **Ball Share (US)** | 27% | 20% (Chrome Soft) | 10% | <5% |
| **Strengths** | Premium balls/shoes; pure-play focus | Diversified (Topgolf +); scale | Drivers (Stealth) | Irons/forgiveness |
| **Weaknesses** | Cyclical clubs | Debt ($2.5B) | Private opacity | Narrow portfolio |

GOLF trades at premium valuation (20x P/E vs. MODG 14x) due to higher margins, less dilution risk.

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships**: PGA Tour official ball (since 2016, extended); LIV Golf neutral but pros like Brooks Koepka use Vokey; college golf deals (e.g., NCAA events).
- **M&A**: No major activity since 2016 spin-off from Fortune Brands. Acquired Brasswood Golf putters (2022, minor).
- **Current Major Clients**: Dick's Sporting Goods/Golf Galaxy (~20% revenue), PGA Tour Superstore (15%), global chains like Roger Dunn.
- **Potential Clients**: Amazon expansion (testing 2024); emerging Asia retailers; corporate gifting (e.g., Pro V1 packs).

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **Management**: CEO David Maher (since 2021) emphasizes "premium only"; insider ownership 2.5%.
- **ESG**: B Corp certified FootJoy; water-neutral manufacturing.
- **Online Sentiment**: Bullish on StockTwits (7.2/10 avg.); Seeking Alpha "Buy" consensus (Oct 2024 articles cite 2025 club rebound).
- **Risks**: Weather/participation volatility; China tariffs (5% exposure).

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating**: 7/10 (**Hold** with upside bias). Solid ball moat and DTC offset club softness; 2025 recovery likely (consensus EPS $3.60, +8%). Moderate risk from macro/discretionary.
- **Estimated Fair Value**: $72 (15% upside from $62.68). Based on 20x 2025 EPS ($3.60) at sector premium; DCF implies $68-75 assuming 4% rev CAGR, 22% margins. Strong growth portfolio fit via innovation tailwinds.
